meanings.definition: Trees or shrubs that retain green leaves throughout the year.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with evergreens, providing shade and beauty all year long.
meanings.sent2: I love the smell of evergreens in the winter, it reminds me of the holidays.
meanings.sent3: The evergreens in the park seemed to be gossiping with each other about the squirrels' antics.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was like an evergreen, always vibrant and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the evergreens against the snow was a picture of resilience and life.

meanings.definition: Plants that do not shed their leaves annually.
meanings.sent1: The garden was full of evergreens, adding color even in the fall.
meanings.sent2: Evergreens are perfect for landscaping because they maintain their foliage year-round.
meanings.sent3: The evergreens in the yard were the envy of the neighborhood, never needing to rake leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to her work was like an evergreen, always present and reliable.
meanings.sent5: The evergreens stood tall and proud, a symbol of endurance and constancy.

meanings.definition: A type of tree or shrub that stays green all year round.
meanings.sent1: In the cold winter, the evergreens provided a splash of color in the white landscape.
meanings.sent2: Evergreens are popular choices for hedges due to their year-round greenery.
meanings.sent3: The evergreens in the garden seemed to be in a competition to see who could grow the tallest.
meanings.sent4: His optimism was like an evergreen, always brightening the mood of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The evergreens swayed gently in the breeze, a reminder of nature's steadfastness.
